member.summary: Exports the specified document to a TIFF file.
member.param: The ActiveReports Document object to export.
The file name and path to save the main html file to.
A range of page numbers to export seperated by a comma. Between each comma can have a single page number, or range of pages with a hyphen between the starting and ending page numbers in the range.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Tiff.Section.TiffExport.CommonExport(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Document.SectionDocument,System.String,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Performs the export logic for a document that is common to all of the export method overloads.
member.param: The Document to be exported.
The range of pages within the document to be exported, can be null or string.empty.
The destination stream for the TIFF output.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Tiff.Section.TiffExport.ScalePage(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Tiff.Section.CompressionScheme,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines the scaled size of the target page based on the specified page width, height and compression scheme.
member.param: The horizontal resolution used to convert from inches to pixels.
The vertical resolution used to convert from inches to pixels.
If landscape is true this function will assume you want to flip the pageWidth/pageHeight values. The page will be scaled as if the pageWidth is the pageHeight and pageHeight is the pageWidth.
member.remarks: At least some CCITT3 devices require that the output image conform to specific resolutions. The page resolution should be 1728 wide 2376 heigh (pixels). I did see one mention of this in the "COMMON-ISDN-API Part 1, Version 2.0". See http://www.capi.org. CCITT is now www.itu.int/www.itu.org, but we have to pay 3K to read the spec :S

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Tiff.Section.TiffExport.PageSizeInfo
member.summary: Used with function.

members.member: Horizontal scale factor that converst old page width to new page width.
Vertical scale factor that converst old page height to new page height.

member.summary: writes additional tags requred for some devices

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Tiff.Section.TiffExportUtil.UpdateAddtionalTagsManually(System.IO.Stream,GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Tiff.Section.CompressionScheme)
member.summary: Update the temp t4options/t6options to real tag.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Tiff.Section.TiffExportUtil.UpdateAddtionalTagsManually(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Update the temp tag 6292 to 292. According to the tiff spec http://partners.adobe.com/public/developer/en/tiff/TIFF6.pdf. The tempTag should larger than realTag.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Tiff.Section.TiffExportUtil.ShouldUpdateAdditionalTagsManually(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Tiff.Section.CompressionScheme)
member.summary: case 168542.Some tags are not generated in windows 2008 R2 and windows7, we should add them manually. Also interest to the special compression secheme which will add the following tags: 1) 292 (T4Options) 2) 293 (T6Options)

member.summary: Represents settings for .

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.#ctor(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes new instance of class with specified settings.
member.param: of specified settings.
FPL flag

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.Pagination
member.summary: By default, each page of a report is rendered as a separate image. Set this value to False to render the entire report as a single image.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.ImageType
member.summary: Select the type of image to which you want to render the report. Supported types are BMP, GIF, JPEG, TIFF, and PNG.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.MarginLeft
member.summary: Set the value in inches to use for the left margin of the image. The format is an integer or decimal with "in" as the suffix, for example "1in" for 1 inch. By default, no margins are used. The value set in this property overrides the report's settings.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.MarginTop
member.summary: Set the value in inches to use for the top margin of the image. The format is an integer or decimal with "in" as the suffix, for example "1in" for 1 inch. By default, no margins are used. The value set in this property overrides the report's settings.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.MarginRight
member.summary: Set the value in inches to use for the right margin of the image. The format is an integer or decimal with "in" as the suffix, for example "1in" for 1 inch. By default, no margins are used. The value set in this property overrides the report's settings.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.MarginBottom
member.summary: Set the value in inches to use for the bottom margin of the image. The format is an integer or decimal with "in" as the suffix, for example "1in" for 1 inch. By default, no margins are used. The value set in this property overrides the report's settings.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.DpiX
member.summary: Adjust the horizontal resolution of rendered images. The default value is 200.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.DpiY
member.summary: Adjust the vertical resolution of rendered images. The default value is 200.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.Compression
member.summary: Sets or returns a value which specifies the compression to be used when exporting.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.Quality
member.summary: Gets or sets the quality of the report to be rendered as an image.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.StartPage
member.summary: The default value of zero in this and the EndPage properties render all of the report pages to images. Otherwise, set this value to the number of the first page to render.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.EndPage
member.summary: The default value of 0 in this property renders all of the report pages. Otherwise, set this value to the number of the last page to render. Please note that if the StartPage property is set to 0, all of the pages of the report render. In order to use the EndPage property, you must set the StartPage property to a valid non-zero number.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.PageHeight
member.summary: Set the value in inches to use for the height of the image. The format is an integer or decimal with "in" as the suffix, for example "11in" for 11 inches. The value set in this property overrides the report's settings.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.PageWidth
member.summary: Set the value in inches to use for the width of the image. The format is an integer or decimal with "in" as the suffix, for example "8in" for 8 inches. The value set in this property overrides the report's settings.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.WatermarkTitle
member.summary: Sets text (i.e. CONFIDENTIAL) to use as the watermark on the image.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.WatermarkAngle
member.summary: Specify the degree of angle for the watermark text on the image. Valid values range from 0 to 359, where 0 is horizontal, left to right.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.WatermarkFontName
member.summary: Set the font to use for the watermark to any valid System.Drawing.Font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.WatermarkFontSize
member.summary: Set the font to use for the watermark to any valid System.Drawing.Font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.WatermarkFontStyle
member.summary: Set the font to use for the watermark to any valid System.Drawing.Font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.WatermarkColor
member.summary: Select a color for the watermark text on the image. The default value for the watermark color is gray, but you can select any Web, System, or Custom color.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.PrintLayoutMode
member.summary: Select how to lay out the pages of the report in the image.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.Page.Settings.SizeToFit
member.summary: By default, rendered report pages are not resized to fit within the selected image size. Set this value to True to resize the report pages.

members.member: Specifies whether the image should be dithered when saving to a black and white output format, like CCITT3 or Rle. This property has no effect if the CompressionScheme property is set to Lzw or None(represents color output).

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.MonochromeBitmapTool
member.summary: Provides a public function for creating a 1 bit per pixel bitmap.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.MonochromeBitmapTool.RgbBmpTo1BppIndexed(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the specified Image object to a one bit per pixel (monchrome) indexed bitmap.
member.param: The source bitmap to be converted to a .
True indicates a dithering algorithm should be used to improve the color conversion.
member.returns: A bitmap converted to monochrome with PixelFormat of 1bppIndexed.
member.remarks: When using dithering, multiple colors typically show up better, but file size will increase. This method contains unsafe code. The caller is responsible for disposing the returned bitmap. This method has an unsafe code block, in order to use and the returned so this method is marked with to prevent a full call stack walk and according to the documentation significantly improve performance.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.MonochromeBitmapTool.ODITHER_SIZE
member.summary: Dimension of dither matrix
member.remarks: NB: if ODITHER_SIZE is not a power of 2, ODITHER_MASK uses will break

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.MonochromeBitmapTool.base_dither_matrix
member.summary: Bayer's order-4 dither array. Generated by the code given in Stephen Hawley's article "Ordered Dithering" in Graphics Gems I. The values in this array must range from 0 to ODITHER_CELLS-1.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Image.MonochromeBitmapTool.Dither(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs a simple ordered dithering algorithm to simulate greyscale in a monochrome (1 bit per pixel) image.
member.param: The x location of the pixel.
The y location of the pixel.
Level should be r+g+b.
member.returns: Either 1 or zero indicating the pixel should be black or white based on the dither matrix.
member.remarks: See Graphics Gems I for detailed information about our dithering algorithm.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Diagnostics.InternalTracer
member.summary: Provides a common way to trace messages that do not show up easily to our users. Support personel or the developer can use the TraceSwitch in a config file (web.config for exe config) to turn tracing on and off.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Diagnostics.InternalTracer.traceSwitchString
member.summary: Put this string in a config file under configuration\system.diagnostics\switches\add to turn on tracing. Then add a listenter under configuration\system.diagnostics\trace\listeners.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Diagnostics.InternalTracer.tracingSwitch
member.summary: Used with this class's LogMessage method to indicate if tracing is turned on or not. I'm using guid strings to keep prying eyes from understanding what's going on, and an attempt ot prevent users from easily turning tracing on.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Diagnostics.InternalTracer.Trace(System.String)
member.summary: Provides tracing when defined appropriately in an application configuration file.
member.param: The trace message to be written to a trace listener.
member.remarks: This could be used with support and an appropriate app.config file to implement tracing when output is messed up for unknown reasons. I've applied these debugger attributes to it to attempt to keep it out of call stacks and debuggers stepping though it. If this method is found to be a sevear performance hinderence (presumably via profiling), then we should be able to uncomment the ConditionalAttribute below and only have it included in DEBUG builds only.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Diagnostics.InternalTracer.Trace(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Provides tracing with string.format like capabilities.

member.name: T:AssemblyNames
member.summary: Contains strong assembly names and such

member.name: T:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils
member.summary: Provides utility functions useful when parsing CanvasItem records in a Canvas/Page.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.AreBoundsClose(System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary: Returns true if the bounds are within 1000'th of an inch of each other.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.OutsideRect(System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns true if element is entirely outside rectangle. False if inside or intersecting.
member.param: Clip rect.
x coordinate for element.
y coordinate for element.
width for element.
height for element.
member.returns: True if element is entirely outside rectangle, otherwise returns false.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.InsideRect(System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified element is entirely inside the specified rectangle (or exactly the same bounds); false if outside or intersecting.
member.param: Clip rect
Line x coordinate.
Line y coordinate.
Line width.
Line height.
member.returns: True if the specified element is entirely inside the specified rectangle; false if outside or intersecting.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.ClipLine(System.Drawing.RectangleF,GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Document.Section.LineItem@,GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Document.Section.LineItem)
member.summary: This function takes a line and a clipping rectangle, and outputs a clipped line in the pNew argument.
member.param: The clipping rectangle.
The new, clipped line will be returned in this argument.
The old line you want clipped.
member.returns: Returns true when the line is entirely outside of the cliprect and therefore not renderable. If the line intersects the cliprect, then ClipLine(..) will generate a line that does fit entirely inside the cliprect and set it to pNew, and true will be returned. If the line is entirely inside the cliprect, then ClipLine simply sets pNew to pOld and returns false.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.IntersectLines(System.Drawing.PointF@,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns true if lines intersect, false if not, sets ppointout to point of intersection.
member.param: If lines intersect, this will be the point of intersection.
X1 coordinate for first line.
Y1 coordinate for first line.
X2 coordinate for first line.
Y2 coordinate for first line.
X1 coordinate for second line.
Y1 coordinate for second line.
X2 coordinate for second line.
Y2 coordinate for second line.
member.returns: True if lines intersect, false if not.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.ClipShapeBounds(System.Drawing.RectangleF@,System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary: Clips the specified bounds for a shape based on the specified clipRect.
member.param: The bounds for the item. Upon return of this function this value will have the clipped bounds.
The clipping rectangle according to which itemBounds will be clipped.
member.returns: True if the item should be rendered according to the new bounds, or false if the item should not be rendered at all.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.ClipImage(System.Drawing.Image@,System.Drawing.RectangleF@,System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary: Clips the specified image if necessary.
member.returns: True if you should render the specified image. Note that the location and actual image arguments may have been changed by this function. False, indicates that you should not render the specified image due to the cliprect. This would normally indicate that the image is entirely outside of the cliprect.

member.name: F:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.DEFAULTPIXELSPERINCH
member.summary: Number of pixels per inch used in unit default conversions.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.InchesToPixels(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the specified inch value in pixel units.
member.param: The value in inches to convert.
The pixels/dots per inch value to be used for the conversion.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.InchesToPixels(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the specifed inch value in pixel units with pixels per inch/dpi value of .
member.param: The value in inches to convert.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.InitStringFormat
member.summary: Returns a initialized for measuring text records in AR.NET. This is typically what would be used with CanvasUtils.GetClippedTextLines.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.MeasureString(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.String,System.Drawing.Font,System.Drawing.SizeF,System.Drawing.StringFormat,System.Single,GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PaddingEx,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Single)
member.summary: RS: CR 23121 - String measurer that takes into account the character spacing
Divides the specified text into lines using \n as line dividers. Also clips the text according to the cliprect specified in context.
member.param: The text to be divided into lines and clipped.
A graphics used for measuring text. Passed in for performance optimization.
A StringFormat used for measuring text. Passed in for performance optimization.
The bounds of the text record from the RDF DrawText2 item.
The context providing information such as font, colors, and cliprect.
Since this function has to calculate the line height anyway, it will return the lineheight it calculated.
The action for manual WrapMode handling if it was not been performed before.
member.returns: Null if text is entirely clipped. Or an array of lines of text clipped based on the specified ExportContext.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.CanvasUtils.DeflateRect(System.Drawing.RectangleF,GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PaddingEx)
member.summary: Deflates the padding from the rect

member.name: T:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.ExportContext
member.summary: This class is basically the same as RenderContext in ActiveReports, but customized for contextual information specific to Exports and not a Graphics. Much of the functionality is exactly the same as RenderContext. However, RenderContext is tightly coupled with each of the CanvasItem's and uses CanvasItem.Render to maintain/update RenderContext, which also does rendering to a Grahpics, which is inappropriate and inefficient for Excel or any Export filter.
member.remarks: Differences between ExportContext and RenderContext: - The current cliprect is manged by ExportContext here, not Graphics like RenderContext. - The ClipStack is a stack of RectangleF structs, and not System.Drawing.Drawing2D.Region. All our clips are rectangles in RDF and I think regions were only used in RenderContext because that's what Graphics uses and rendercontext stores it's "current cliprect" on the Grahpics, not RenderContext.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.ExportContext.#ctor(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Document.Section.Document.Filters.IFilteredPage)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the ExportContext.
member.param: The DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Page object that this context is relative to. All fonts (see ) are slected from the Page's Fonts collection.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.ExportContext.GetDefaultFontWithPointUnit
member.summary: Clone font for azure while sizeinpoints throw outofmemory exception.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.ExportContext.PushClipRect
member.summary: Takes the current clipRect (in CurrentClipRect property) and pushes it onto the ClipStack. The current cliprect is still maintained as the "current cliprect".

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.ExportContext.PopClipRect
member.summary: Takes the last cliprect put onto the stack and sets it as the current cliprect. If there are no cliprects on the stack then the current cliprect is cleared, and IsClipActive is set to false.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.ExportContext.IntersectClipRect(System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary: Uses member method RectangleF.Intersect on the currentCliprect to calculate the intersecting clipping rectangle and sets that resulting clip rect as the current clip rect available via the ClipRect property.
member.param: The clipping rectangle to intersect the current clipping rectangle with.

member.name: P:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.ExportContext.ClipRect
member.summary: Returns the current cliprect bounding the output device/surface.

member.name: P:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.ExportContext.ClipStack
member.summary: Returns the Stack of RectangleF structs.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.ExportContext.Clone
member.summary: Returns an instance of ExportContext that contains an exact replica of the data on this object. ** Note this method does not copy the m_theFonts font follection. Only .Font/m_theFont. For performance reasons, and because I don't see why it's needed in most cases where you would clone this class.

member.name: M:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.ExportContext.SelectFont(System.Int16)
member.summary: Sets the Font property's value to the font at the specified Index.

member.name: P:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.ExportContext.CharacterSpacing
member.summary: Determines the intercharacter spacing in inches

member.name: P:DataDynamics.ActiveReports.Export.InternalC.ExportContext.LineSpacing
member.summary: Determines the interline spacing in inches
